Tucson knew tensions were tight when it came to being around Perceptor. Sti=
ll he keeps his beliefs in the ex Predacon, and quietly listens to the conv=
ersations.  He knew deep down that Perceptor was turning over a new leaf, e=
ven if the others didn't quite believe it was true.  As he regains a lot of=
 his strength, he is now able to stand up on his feet by himself, without s=
tumbling.  He turns his head in the direction of where Optimus Prime's body=
 lay.  He knew a visit to his fallen leader would benefit his own piece of =
mind.

"Excuse me everyone, I won't be long."

He begins walking slowly at =
first, but then regains his footing as he passes through doorways, and back=
 into the room where Optimus Prime's body lay.  Just by his sonars he could=
 pinpoint where he was and then kneels down in front of his lifeless body.
=

"There are so many things I never got to ask you.  One of them being, how =
does one find the perfect balance between trust and loyalty?  And how does =
one find peace in an atmosphere full of tension?  But most of all Optimus, =
our paths appear to be the same, our values, our courage, our strength and =
our faith in those around us.  Are our origins alike?  If so, is there a di=
rection I should be going toward? One that will help me to guide the Autobo=
ts and Maximals to finding the road toward peaceful existance?  If anyone w=
ould know these answers, you would."

He puts a tiny orb of his own spark i=
nto a container, and gives it as an offering to Optimus Prime.
